content: Software process evaluations are used to determine

choices.C: potential risks to the assigned projects
choices.D: whether a project is ready to make the transition to the next phase
choices.A: how much progress the supplier is making toward completing assigned tasks
choices.B: how much progress the supplier is making toward process improvement

content: Which of the following is a benefit of using the goalquestion-metric paradigm when software metrics are selected?

choices.B: Metrics are selected on the basis of organizational objectives
choices.C: Buy-in from the project personnel is achieved for the selected metrics
choices.D: Metric models are simplified to include only the most important elements

content: With respect to sample size and its relationship to confidence level and margin of error, which of the following statements is true?

choices.A: No correlation exists between sample size and either confidence level or margin of error
choices.B: The smaller the acceptable margin for error, the smaller the sample size
choices.C: The larger the sample size, the higher the confidence level
choices.D: The smaller the sample size, the higher the confidence level

content: Which of the following statements is true about white-box testing?

choices.C: It is usually done after black-box testing
choices.D: It is usually done during the integration testing phase.

content: Which of the following is most likely to compromise the integrity of data collected in a software metrics program?

choices.C: Using the data to monitor team performance
choices.D: Using the data to monitor individual performance

content: Which of the following techniques is used in identifying underlying problems?

choices.C: Force field analysis

content: The most appropriate driver for developing metrics is

choices.A: poor results in internal quality audits
choices.C: customer complaints

content: A company is experiencing competitive pressures for market share from a low-cost competitor. The company is in the process of adding new functionality to their software products. If their goal is to minimize development costs, which of the following metrics is best suited to measure the achievement of that goal?

choices.C: Customer surveys

content:
What is the standard deviation of the population below?
10, 4, 16, 12, 8
The number of lines of code to be developed during a software project is defined as a/an:

choices.C: Entity of the software

content: In general, Perto analysis is an application measure of software quality because:

choices.C: Software defects tend to cluster in the most complex component
choices.D: Software defects tend to cluster in a random number of components
choices.A: Software defects tend to cluster in a small number of components
choices.B: Software defects tend to cluster in a majority of components

content: A performance dashboard displays:

choices.C: Many different types of chars and displays

content: Volatility metrics are typically applied to:

choices.C: Project acceleration

content: Which of the following is the best tool to determine if there is a relationship between the amount of time a customer is in the showroom compared to the amount of maney the customer spends?

choices.C: Histogram

content: The acronym KSLOC represents which type of software attribute?

choices.C: Coverage

content: The sum of the squared deviations of a group of measurements from their mean divided by the number of measurements equals the:

choices.C: Range

content: The Likert scale is what type of scale?

choices.C: Interval

content: A metric established to measure the number of error messages a tester can test per hour can be used to:

choices.B: Determine the number of error messages used in future computer programs
choices.C: Improve the tester's performance
choices.D: Reduce the number of error messages tested for the next module
choices.A: Predict the useability of the computer program

content: The ideal value for defect removal efficiency is:

choices.C: Greater than 1

content: Which of the following techniques would be considered a framework to select the appropriate metric for project use?

choices.C: The SLIM model

content: The cyclomatic complexity metric, developed by McCabe, is used to measure the complexity of a software program. This metric directly measures the:

choices.C: Commands executed in the source code

content: The level of usage of debugging tools by programmers is listed below:

choices.A: No debuggin tool used at all other than an editor
choices.C: Editor with trace and flow aide used
choices.D: Editor with trace, flow and cross-reference used

content: lnterrelationship digraphs should be used in which of the following situations?

choices.A: When the course of events is known
choices.B: When critical times must be developed
choices.C: When value analysis needs to be done
choices.D: When root causes and effects are needed

content: What will be the impact on results when only the best or easiest to collect data is taken?

choices.C: Data will be skewed left or right

content: From the table below, what is the approximate defect removal effectiveness at the design phase?
The primary difference between dashboards and scorecards is:

choices.C: Different types of charts versus raw data
choices.D: Monitoring operations versus charting strategic goals

content: From a software quality engineering perspective, what factor must always be taken into account in measurement programs?

choices.C: Human psychology

content: On the basis of the control chart above, which of the following statements is true?

choices.A: Components 1, 2, 3, and 5 should be reinspected because they are below the mean.
choices.B: Only component 4 should be investigated because it is closest to the upper control limit.
choices.C: Components 4, 6, 7, 8 and 9 should be investigated because they are above the mean
choices.D: No action is required; all data points are within acceptable statistical variance.

content: After the control chart above was generated, three more components were inspected at the following rates:10: 312 LOC per hour11: 420 LOC per hour12: 29 LOC per hourIn this situation, which of the following actions should be taken, if any?

choices.A: A reinspection should be performed on component 10.
choices.B: Unit testing of component 12 should be increased.
choices.C: The high inspection rate of component 11 should be investigated.

content: According to the CMMISM, the purpose of software project planning is to

choices.D: allow the software engineering group to participate actively with the other engineering groups
choices.A: provide management with the actual project processes so that effective corrective actions can be taken
choices.B: provide a common understanding of the functional requirements between the customer and the software project engineering group
choices.C: establish and maintain plans that define project activities

content: A customer satisfaction survey used the following rating scale: 1 = very satisfied 2 = satisfied 3 = neutral 4 = dissatisfied 5 = very dissatisfied This is an example of which of the following measurement scales?

choices.C: Ratio

content: A defect-seeding program inserts 81 defects into an application. Inspections and testing found 5,832 defects. Of these, 72 were seeded defects. How many errors or defects are predicted to remain in the application?
If the entire area under the Rayleigh curve becomes smaller, then the projected defect rate will be

choices.C: lower in production

content: Which of the following is the most important criterion for selecting a software reliability model?

choices.C: Simplicity

content: A project manager has been transferred to a major software development project that is in the implementation phase. The highest priority for this project manager should be to

choices.A: establish a relationship with the customer
choices.B: learn the project objectives and the existing project plan
choices.C: modify the project’s organizational structure to meet the manager’s management style
choices.D: ensure that the project proceeds at its current pace
